thread.title: Philadelphia's police commissioner announces he is retiring
thread.title_full: Philadelphia's police commissioner announces he is retiring - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Philadelphia's police commissioner announces he is retiring
text:
By MICHAEL R. SISAK
Associated Press PHILADELPHIA (AP) - Philadelphia's police commissioner says he is retiring.
Charles Ramsey announced his retirement Wednesday at a news conference as the administration that brought him to the city comes to an end. His last day will be Jan. 7.
Mayor Michael Nutter brought the 65-year-old Ramsey to Philadelphia in 2008 when he took office. The city's next mayor will take office in January.
The murder rate in the city dropped since Ramsey took office, from 391 homicides the year before he arrived to 248 last year.
Ramsey is also the co-chairman of President Barack Obama's task force on 21st-century policing.
He was previously chief of the Metropolitan Police Department in Washington, D.C., and rose through the ranks of his native Chicago's police department to become deputy superintendent.
